1.effectsDescription: Music speed is affected by Isaac's walking speed.

2.effectsDescription: The lower Isaac's health is, the slower the music is.

4.effectsDescription: All enemies blend into the ground.

5.effectsDescription: Pickups and items blend into the ground.

6.effectsDescription: Isaac, enemies, pickups, and items all blend into the ground.

7.effectsDescription: All sound effects are replaced with farts.

8.effectsDescription: Applies a filter that makes the game look like it's being played through a cathode ray tube.

10.effectsDescription: Removes the HUD entirely. This affects the map, health, consumables, held items, pickup text, floor names, and more.

12.effectsDescription: All movement and firing keys are reversed.

13.effectsDescription: All enemies turn into champions if possible.

20.effectsDescription: Every few seconds, all enemies become scared.

21.effectsDescription: All enemies are permanently charmed and scared.

23.effectsDescription: Makes a lot more blood appear after enemies die.

24.effectsDescription: Isaac leaves a trail of poop behind him as he walks.

25.effectsDescription: Enemies do not take damage. All rooms are considered cleared upon entering them; doors stay open, room rewards spawn, Stonies instantly die. When in a boss room, the boss's health bar is used as a timer and slowly ticks down. At the end of the countdown, the trapdoor to the next floor appears.

26.effectsDescription: Isaac takes damage if he stops moving.

27.effectsDescription: Every 45 seconds, a ticking will begin, and after 5 seconds, Isaac will take 1/2 heart of damage. Damage increases to 1 heart in Chapter 4 and beyond. Having invincibility during the time when damage should be inflicted blocks the damage.

28.effectsDescription: Gives a time limit of 30 minutes to beat the game. When the timer hits 29:45, a timer starts ticking, and after 30:00, Isaac takes damage every second.

29.effectsDescription: All pill names and descriptions show ???.

30.effectsDescription: All card names and descriptions show ???.

32.effectsDescription: Enemies, including bosses, respawn once Isaac leaves the room. Completing a room multiple times does not yield additional pickups.

33.effectsDescription: Isaac starts with 69 coins, but all items and consumables must be bought.

37.effectsDescription: Isaac and his tears turn completely black.

47.effectsDescription: Isaac takes a full heart of damage from all sources.

48.effectsDescription: Isaac takes twelve hearts of damage from all sources.

63.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of Darkness.

64.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of the Labyrinth.

65.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of the Lost.

66.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of the Unknown.

67.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of the Maze.

68.effectsDescription: Provides immunity to Curse of the Blind.

71.effectsDescription: Boss rooms lock Isaac in, similar to the Mom fight.

72.effectsDescription: Pickups quickly fade. This includes pedestal items, shop purchases, devil deals, and the Cathedral/Sheol boss chest.

74.effectsDescription: Isaac automatically fires tears in the same direction that he moves. Removes the ability to fire tears manually.

75.effectsDescription: Isaac automatically fires tears in the opposite direction that he moves. Removes the ability to fire tears manually.

77.effectsDescription: While Isaac is not moving, time runs extremely slowly. Isaac's speed and fire rate remain normal at all times.

78.effectsDescription: Screen has a permanent Retro-Vision effect.
